column4: i installed apache2 but all the important files are under /var/www/apache2-default/ not under /var/www/ so when i type "http://127.0.0.1/" from a browser it shows me the dir of "/var/www/" so how can i fix it?
change the "sererroot" directive in apache config
its not empty, it includes other files
but when i double click it i looks empty
no but subversion and svn are the same things right?
subversion is the product, svn is the command
well how do i install svn?
yes, but why do you want the svn version ov django ?
because it is the latest version of django
its also unstable and may be buggy
I'll ask again, why do you want the latest version
more so if you can't figure out the tools you need to get it
what is in the 0.6 version you want thats not in the 0.95 ?

if you don't know why - don't do it, so use the ubuntu packaged version
